title: Fixing issue with Random Quotes App: screen not waking up during daytime...
message:
Fixing issue with Random Quotes App: screen not waking up during daytime...

* Random Quotes App.
    Fix Issue: window manager doesn't force a screen turn ON at daytime.
    Use Wakelocks (deprecated) to turn screen ON until they become
    obsolete.

    You already did your research, and you spent hell of a long time to
    cover every corner (wakelocks, brightness and window parameters),
    do not waste more time on this!

    As it stands today Android has no way to allow the application to turn
    the device screen ON/OFF within an started activity. If you use their
    windows parametters you can only set the TURN_SCREEN_ON FLAG only once
    at the creation of the activity, aftwerwards there is no way to turn
    the screen OFF, ON multiple times as our application requires.

    You can use the brightness hack, but of course:
    - Brightness 0 does not actually mean the screen is OFF only as dim as
        possible (in both of my devices the screen is still ON).
    - If the user locks the screen, which everyone does, brightness can not
        really turn the screen back ON.

    Like most dirty hacks, it looks like it would work and then ....it's
    useless, it is not intended for that purpose.

    The wakelocks provide the necessary functionality and they do what they
    are intended to do without nasty hacks. We will use them from now on
    until Android makes them obsolete at which point, we need to figure out
    alternatives.
    > Done.

* Random quotes App.
    Make daytime based on event, not tied to updates runnable.
    Why? is it really necessary? It's not. Tie it to the runnable update.
    C'mon, you don't need it.
    > Done.

title: Ongoing development of v2.1 features.
message:
Ongoing development of v2.1 features.

* Quote Display Apps.
    Fix the android development scripts so they are useful to anyone.
    (Use printf only, no echo.)
    > Done.

* Random Quotes App.
    Select 3rd party file/dir choser library.
    aFileDialog, simple and good licensing, no Nonsense integration with anything.
    > Done.

* Random Quotes App.
    Build aFileDialog, modify and use to fit our purposes.
    > Done.

* Random Quotes App.
    Add support for scanning directories.
    First make sure the functionality is there, we will optimize prior
    to release.
    > Done.

* Random Quotes Widget.
    Replicate common changes from quotes App.
    Completed except for variable update period for the widget which
    requires the use of an alarm manager, lets try this on Monday.
    Otherwise we will keep it static as this is not critical
    functionality for the widget.
    > Done.

title: Completed implementation of timeProperties save/read and started scanning research.
message:
Completed implementation of timeProperties save/read and started scanning research.

* Quotes Display Apps.
    - Add suport for time properties in user preferences.
    > Done.

* Quotes Display Apps.
    - Allow public access to delete methods for clearing user prefs.
    > Done.

* Quote Display Apps.
    - Complete Set/store time properties, read and use time properties.
    - Integration with daytime screenlock and keyguardlock
    > Done.

* Quote Display Apps.
    Use installed file-chooser for selecting dirs.
    We need a file/directory chooser, using user-installed file explorers
    is not stable and maintainable (they use different intents ...etc).
    > Done.

* Quote Display Apps.
    File/directory chooser Research (final candidates).
    - FilePicker Library
    - noNonsense FilePicker
    - aFileDialog
    > Done.

* Check License compatibility
    - FilePicker Library: Apache v2.
    - noNonsense FilePicker: MPLv2
    - aFileDialog: LGPLv2
    They are all compatible with GPLv3 as long as the derivative work
    is under GPLv3.
    > Done.
